page.title: 14TRADE
page.content: SHOPPING IS A DIFFICULT TASK IN THIS AREA_ THERE IS ONLY A POTTERY- NO SHOP AT ALL SELLING FOOD OF ANY DESCRIPTION. THE VILLAGERS OF VELINDRE ARE ABLE TO CATCH A BUS TO THE MARKET TOWN OF HAY ON WYE ON A THURSDAY. IN HAY THERE ARE A NUMBER OF GROCERY STORES BUT NO LARGE SHOPS OR SUPERMARKET SO PRICES ARE FAIRLY HIGH. THE HAY MARKET IS VERY POPULAR FOR FRUIT, CLOTHES AND SUCH PRODUCTS AS CHEESE AND EGGS. PAPERS ARE DELIVERED DAILY AS IS MILK AND A BAKER AND GROCER HAVE FITTED VANS WHICH VISIT THE VILLAGE TWICE WEEKLY. ABOUT A THIRD OF THE INHABITANTS SHOP IN BRECON OR HEREFORD AT THE WEEKENDS BUT THOSE WITHOUT CARS HAVE LITTLE ALTERNATIVE BUT TO CATCH THE BUS TO HAY.
